content.description: Start down and left of inception and do a right hand move into the start of inception then match in and bust it out of the cave. Make a long move to the lip from a good undercling for the LH and then mantle. (You could also start on Matt's cave)

Tried this after being wrongfully told that this was super chunk, certainly didn’t believe them but it’s still fun.  Start right hand in the pocket start hold of Matt’s cave and left hand on the inception jug. Move left hand into the side pull/under cling slot, right hand to the corner crimp/pinch (if you want) then go straight for the lip. Much different than the throw on Super chunk as you have more options for holds and feet making it significantly easier, maybe even easier than Matt’s cave?
content.location: Right side of the inception roof.

content.description: Start sitting on a good undercling and sidecling. Pull up to sloping crimps and scramble over the lip onto the slab
content.location: Undercling on the same face and to the left of Handsome Blunderstone

climbs.name: Matt's Roof to Left Lip Traverse.

content.description: Start as for Matt's roof and climb to the lip. Once at the lip, traverse left to top out as for inception.
Fun 2-move diggler with a large toss and some tension.
content.location: Start on lowest jug in the cave and migrate to the right arete.

content.description: Start sitting on good holds. Climb the face/bulge just left of the arete.
content.location: On the RH side of the west face of the Inception boulder

content.description: Start on obvious rail and compress up the left arete.
content.location: West side of the first boulder you meet on the tail.

content.description: Start sitting on sloper jugs on the right and traverse left via underclings, top out in the middle of the face via slopers
content.location: On the west side of the inception boulder

content.description: Start on holds at shoulder height in the middle of the face and trend up left.
content.location: middle west face of inception boulder

content.description:
Start standing at the blocky jug on the Northeast Face just left of Flight of the Conchords.  Drop in on rail heading down and left.  Climb through mini cave on jugs, then punch left on powerful moves to reach a sloping nose feature on the corner.  Follow the rail to the start of Handsome Jansen.  Finish on the problem but with a left exit to round out the traverse.  Link to video of ascent here:

https://youtu.be/t4-IIlCrk-k

.. I’m proposing V10 Traverse, but might be a touch easier—I welcome other opinions.
content.location: Start on blocky jug on Northeast face.

content.description:
Sit Start on the NE corner of the inception boulder on two small crimps just right of the down climb (see pic)

Traverse right across slopers and crimps staying below the arete edge feature for about 8 ft until the edge turns upward, and follow it to the top.

maybe a little soft for a V4, but it seemed harder than Short Wonder on the other side.

probably done before by Sam, but not in the BB or here. If anyone knows a different name let me know.
start on Inception (or better on Matt's cave)and traverse left, turn the corner and finish on easy slab. Very dabby!

This is an eliminate variation of the Handsome blundersome face. Sit start on the low rail used for Jansen's move but climb straight up without the use of the right jug rail (refer to picture for route intention). Gain the crimper/undercling and go up to a small finger pocket over the lip via bad slopers and high feet. If you can get over the fact it is an eliminate, it really is a nice boulder.  Give it a go and leave feed back. This start can also be added into handsome blunder some for a much harder variation. Or linking Jansen's move into this direct topout without the use of the arete is another fun variation and increases the difficulty.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, the landing is a bit sloped and rooted.
content.location: On the handsome blundersome face of the inception boulder. Refer to photo for route intention.
